content.description: Finger crack sized layback with great feet on the rail/ ledge to left.  Good hold in crack leads to long reach for lip.  Use crack or block to top out.
content.protection: Anchor made using a few great cracks up top and extended to the ledge.  Used 2"-4" cams in different cracks and master point fed into crack.  Rope hard to manage through crack. (Lots of drag)  Could be bouldered with at least two pads and a spotter.
content.location: Located on the right side of tallest rock formation.  Just to the right of "Do it for Mel".

climbs.name: My Brains... Are Going Into My Feet!

content.description:
Start on the two right most crimps on the footrail of Lone Star. Traverse left with shouldery moves into the jug start of Luke, I Am Your Mother.

https://youtu.be/23Gqzg-PD-U

Climb starts at *The End is Near* working left staying low traversing around the corner and through the crack. The crux begins with both hands on a fin like crimp moving to a slopper on the left and reaching for the high jug/bulge around the last corner. Avoiding using anything above the crimp/ slopper getting around the corner and finishing as far left as possible into the *Ludicrous Speed* mantle.
content.location: Starts at the southern most boulder which has a chossy top and faded spray paint that reads “Go Drugs” just left of a crack. Climb starts at the  right most start which reads “The End is Near.”

content.description: Starts with sidepull from left. good-ish feet.
content.location: Middle face between crack and Gription

content.description: Crux is first two moved with no feet. Harder if you are 4'6" or less
content.location: blunt nose of boulder on the right side

content.description:
SDS both hands on the large edge where your feet are before the Lone Star top out. Feet are out right pressed and/or into a heel hook. Throw for the slopey edge halfway through the arete, match and pull through. Mantle and top out.

Feet on the formation to the left are off.

Enjoyable little line to add to your circuit.
content.location: Left side of the Lone Star boulder up the vertical arete. SDS on large edge, feet out right.

content.description:
Lay down start on a decent flat ledge for the left and a slightly less good crimp for the right (at the same height). Make a difficult move up and right to another decent edge. Do your best not to dab while working up a featured slanted ledge, around left to an edge/pinch, and up to the mantle of Ludicrous Speed.

Feels V7ish to me. Might be easier.

Ludicrous Speed Low
content.location: On the lower right face of Ludicrous Speed. Work up and left into the mantle of Ludicrous Speed.

content.description: Farthest climb left on the boulder with a variety of different starts all leading to an obvious mantle.
content.location: On the West side of the first and Largest Boulder

content.description: Route starts with feet on a rail that traverses left to a mantle finish.
content.location: In the north east corner of the clearing

content.description:
Fun and short compression problem at the left arete of the dark helmet boulder. Start with a low left hand and a right hand on the slanted edge. Slap up the arete or into a dish and then hit the lip. Mantle directly over. Really spits you out. Feels about V6 in comparison to Dark Helmet V3-4.

Hyperjets

Two good hand holds with a solid foot hold for the start.  Small rail mid way up that is sharp on the left side and more smooth on the right.  Be careful of loose rocks and glass, looks like someone threw some beer bottles at the rock face.
content.location: South East side of "may gription be with you".  (right side if looking at the rock face).

content.description: Tall boulder that has some dynamic moves and big holds. You do get pretty high over the crash pad but has good holds throughout the climb. This route and Planet space balls is a great place to come out for beginner outdoor climbers. Best way to get up to the climb is to park by Sage Creek High school and follow the trail to the water tower. From the base and top of the route you have a view of the ocean and the preserve.
content.location: left side of the tallest rock formation. West of Lone Star.

content.description: The first two moves are the crux.The feet are not very good.
content.location: To the left of moranis face

content.description: Starts at crack on the right, hands move left on the lip to decent sloppers and mantle to finish.
content.protection: Defiantly a friend (the human kind). Crash pad
content.location:
To the west of Do it for Mel

the farthest west boulder on the field
